page.title: 08CODDINGTON VILLAGE
page.content: This{hamlet,}clustered round the{13th {Century Church}which was built on the site of an earlier Saxon Church of around AD 1148, seems hardly touched by the 20th Century. There were only three houses built in the last 30 years. The{Post Office}closed 15 years ago, the{school}17 years ago, the children being bused to Colwall and Bosbury Primary, and Ledbury Secondary Schools. There is only a visiting District Nurse and the nearest general hospitals are at Hereford and Worcester. There is{no gas, no shop {and no Public Transport}in the village. The majority of the residents are elderly and those in employment {commute}to Birmingham, Bristol, Cheltenham and Worcester, or work locally in Malvern and Ledbury.
